controllers.smc.core.switching_functions¶

Source: src\controllers\smc\core\switching_functions.py

Module Overview¶

Switching Functions for SMC Chattering Reduction.

Provides continuous approximations to the discontinuous sign function used in SMC. These functions reduce chattering while maintaining the robustness properties of SMC.

Mathematical Background:

  • Sign function: sign(s) = {+1 if s>0, -1 if s<0, 0 if s=0}

  • Continuous approximations smooth the switching to reduce high-frequency oscillations

  • Trade-off: smoother switching reduces chattering but may increase steady-state error

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#================== src/controllers/smc/core/switching_functions.py ===================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Switching Functions for SMC Chattering Reduction.
  7
  8Provides continuous approximations to the discontinuous sign function used in SMC.
  9These functions reduce chattering while maintaining the robustness properties of SMC.
 10
 11Mathematical Background:
 12- Sign function: sign(s) = {+1 if s>0, -1 if s<0, 0 if s=0}
 13- Continuous approximations smooth the switching to reduce high-frequency oscillations
 14- Trade-off: smoother switching reduces chattering but may increase steady-state error
 15"""
 16
 17from typing import Union, Callable
 18import numpy as np
 19from enum import Enum
 20
 21
 22class SwitchingMethod(Enum):
 23    """Available switching function methods."""
 24    TANH = "tanh"
 25    LINEAR = "linear"
 26    SIGN = "sign"
 27    SIGMOID = "sigmoid"
 28
 29
 30class SwitchingFunction:
 31    """
 32    Continuous switching functions for SMC chattering reduction.
 33
 34    Provides various approximations to the sign function, each with different
 35    smoothness and robustness characteristics.
 36    """
 37
 38    def __init__(self, method: Union[str, SwitchingMethod] = SwitchingMethod.TANH):
 39        """
 40        Initialize switching function.
 41
 42        Args:
 43            method: Switching method ("tanh", "linear", "sign", "sigmoid")
 44        """
 45        if isinstance(method, str):
 46            try:
 47                self.method = SwitchingMethod(method.lower())
 48            except ValueError:
 49                raise ValueError(f"Unknown switching method: {method}")
 50        else:
 51            self.method = method
 52
 53        # Set the appropriate switching function
 54        self._switch_func = self._get_switching_function()
 55
 56    def _get_switching_function(self) -> Callable[[float, float], float]:
 57        """Get the appropriate switching function implementation."""
 58        if self.method == SwitchingMethod.TANH:
 59            return self._tanh_switching
 60        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.LINEAR:
 61            return self._linear_switching
 62        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.SIGN:
 63            return self._sign_switching
 64        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.SIGMOID:
 65            return self._sigmoid_switching
 66        else:
 67            raise ValueError(f"Unimplemented switching method: {self.method}")
 68
 69    def compute(self, surface_value: float, boundary_layer: float) -> float:
 70        """
 71        Compute switching function value.
 72
 73        Args:
 74            surface_value: Sliding surface value
 75            boundary_layer: Boundary layer thickness (ε > 0)
 76
 77        Returns:
 78            Switching function output in range [-1, 1]
 79        """
 80        # Mathematical safety validation
 81        if not np.isfinite(surface_value):
 82            return 0.0  # Safe fallback for invalid input
 83        if not np.isfinite(boundary_layer) or boundary_layer <= 0:
 84            boundary_layer = 1e-12  # Use minimal positive value to prevent division by zero
 85
 86        return self._switch_func(surface_value, boundary_layer)
 87
 88    def _tanh_switching(self, s: float, epsilon: float, slope: float = 3.0) -> float:
 89        """
 90        Hyperbolic tangent switching function with configurable slope.
 91
 92        Formula: tanh((slope * s)/ε)
 93
 94        Properties:
 95        - Smooth and infinitely differentiable
 96        - Bounded output: [-1, 1]
 97        - Good balance between smoothness and approximation quality
 98        - Preserves nonzero slope at origin
 99        - Configurable slope parameter for tuning smoothness (default: 3.0)
100
101        Args:
102            s: Sliding surface value
103            epsilon: Boundary layer thickness
104            slope: Slope parameter (lower = smoother, typical range: 2-5)
105
106        Note:
107            Reduced default slope from implicit 10+ to 3.0 for better chattering reduction.
108            Original steep slopes caused near-discontinuous behavior.
109        """
110        # Enhanced mathematical safety
111        if epsilon <= 0:
112            return np.sign(s)
113
114        # Apply gentler slope for smoother transitions
115        # Lower slope values (2-5) provide better chattering reduction
116        # compared to steep slopes (10+) which behave like sign function
117        ratio = (slope * s) / epsilon
118
119        # Prevent numerical overflow in tanh computation
120        if abs(ratio) > 700:  # tanh(700) ≈ 1, tanh(-700) ≈ -1
121            return np.sign(s)
122
123        return np.tanh(ratio)
124
125    def _linear_switching(self, s: float, epsilon: float) -> float:
126        """
127        Piecewise-linear saturation switching function.
128
129        Formula: sat(s/ε) = clip(s/ε, -1, 1)
130
131        Properties:
132        - Simple and computationally efficient
133        - Bounded output: [-1, 1]
134        - Linear in boundary layer, constant outside
135        - Can cause degraded robustness near origin (zero slope outside boundary)
136        """
137        # Enhanced mathematical safety
138        if epsilon <= 0:
139            return np.sign(s)
140
141        # Safe division with overflow check
142        ratio = s / epsilon
143        if not np.isfinite(ratio):
144            return np.sign(s)
145
146        return np.clip(ratio, -1, 1)
147
148    def _sign_switching(self, s: float, epsilon: float) -> float:
149        """
150        Pure sign function (discontinuous).
151
152        Formula: sign(s)
153
154        Properties:
155        - Theoretically optimal robustness
156        - Discontinuous at origin
157        - Causes chattering in practice
158        - Use only when chattering is acceptable
159        """
160        # Epsilon is ignored for pure sign function
161        return np.sign(s)
162
163    def _sigmoid_switching(self, s: float, epsilon: float, slope: float = 4.0) -> float:
164        """
165        Sigmoid switching function with configurable slope.
166
167        Formula: 2/(1 + exp(-slope*s/ε)) - 1
168
169        Properties:
170        - Smooth and bounded
171        - Similar to tanh but different curvature
172        - Good for adaptive controllers requiring sigmoid characteristics
173        - Configurable slope (default: 4.0 for adaptive nature)
174
175        Args:
176            s: Sliding surface value
177            epsilon: Boundary layer thickness
178            slope: Slope parameter (typical: 3-5 for smooth control)
179        """
180        # Enhanced mathematical safety
181        if epsilon <= 0:
182            return np.sign(s)
183
184        # Apply configurable slope for tuning
185        ratio = -slope * s / epsilon
186
187        # Prevent numerical overflow in exponential
188        if ratio > 700:  # exp(700) overflows
189            return -1.0
190        elif ratio < -700:  # exp(-700) underflows
191            return 1.0
192
193        exp_term = np.exp(ratio)
194        if not np.isfinite(exp_term):
195            return np.sign(s)
196
197        return 2.0 / (1.0 + exp_term) - 1.0
198
199    def get_derivative(self, surface_value: float, boundary_layer: float) -> float:
200        """
201        Compute derivative of switching function.
202
203        Useful for analysis and adaptive boundary layer methods.
204        """
205        s, epsilon = surface_value, boundary_layer
206
207        if self.method == SwitchingMethod.TANH:
208            if epsilon <= 0:
209                return 0.0  # Sign function has zero derivative almost everywhere
210            tanh_val = np.tanh(s / epsilon)
211            return (1.0 - tanh_val**2) / epsilon
212
213        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.LINEAR:
214            if epsilon <= 0 or abs(s) >= epsilon:
215                return 0.0  # Zero derivative outside boundary layer
216            return 1.0 / epsilon
217
218        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.SIGMOID:
219            if epsilon <= 0:
220                return 0.0
221            exp_term = np.exp(-2.0 * s / epsilon)
222            return (4.0 / epsilon) * exp_term / (1.0 + exp_term)**2
223
224        else:  # SIGN
225            return 0.0
226
227
228# Convenience functions for direct use
229def tanh_switching(s: float, epsilon: float, slope: float = 3.0) -> float:
230    """
231    Hyperbolic tangent switching function with optimized slope.
232
233    Args:
234        s: Sliding surface value
235        epsilon: Boundary layer thickness
236        slope: Slope parameter (default: 3.0 for optimal chattering reduction)
237
238    Returns:
239        tanh((slope * s)/ε) ∈ [-1, 1]
240
241    Note:
242        Default slope reduced from steep (10+) to gentle (3.0) for better
243        chattering reduction. Use slope=2-5 for smooth control, slope>5
244        approaches discontinuous behavior.
245    """
246    if epsilon <= 0:
247        return np.sign(s)
248    ratio = (slope * s) / epsilon
249    if abs(ratio) > 700:
250        return np.sign(s)
251    return np.tanh(ratio)
252
253
254def linear_switching(s: float, epsilon: float) -> float:
255    """
256    Linear saturation switching function.
257
258    Args:
259        s: Sliding surface value
260        epsilon: Boundary layer thickness
261
262    Returns:
263        sat(s/ε) = clip(s/ε, -1, 1)
264    """
265    if epsilon <= 0:
266        return np.sign(s)
267    return np.clip(s / epsilon, -1, 1)
268
269
270def sign_switching(s: float, epsilon: float = 0.0) -> float:
271    """
272    Pure sign function (DEPRECATED - causes severe chattering).
273
274    WARNING: Discontinuous switching causes chattering in real systems.
275    Prefer tanh_switching() or linear_switching() with appropriate boundary layer.
276
277    Args:
278        s: Sliding surface value
279        epsilon: Ignored (kept for interface consistency)
280
281    Returns:
282        sign(s) ∈ {-1, 0, 1}
283
284    Deprecated:
285        Use tanh_switching(s, epsilon, slope=3.0) instead for chattering reduction.
286    """
287    import warnings
288    warnings.warn(
289        "sign_switching() is deprecated and causes severe chattering. "
290        "Use tanh_switching(s, epsilon, slope=3.0) for smooth control.",
291        DeprecationWarning,
292        stacklevel=2
293    )
294    return np.sign(s)
295
296
297def adaptive_boundary_layer(surface_value: float, surface_derivative: float,
298                           base_epsilon: float, adaptation_gain: float = 0.1) -> float:
299    """
300    Adaptive boundary layer thickness based on surface derivative.
301
302    Larger ε when |ṡ| is large (fast surface motion) to increase smoothness.
303    Smaller ε when |ṡ| is small (near surface) to maintain precision.
304
305    Args:
306        surface_value: Current sliding surface value
307        surface_derivative: Surface time derivative ṡ
308        base_epsilon: Base boundary layer thickness
309        adaptation_gain: Adaptation coefficient
310
311    Returns:
312        Adaptive boundary layer thickness
313    """
314    adaptive_component = adaptation_gain * abs(surface_derivative)
315    return base_epsilon + adaptive_component
316
317
318def power_rate_reaching_law(surface_value: float, K: float, alpha: float,
319                           epsilon: float = 0.01) -> float:
320    """
321    Power rate reaching law for finite-time convergence.
322
323    Formula: -K * |s|^α * sign(s) ≈ -K * |s|^α * tanh(s/ε)
324
325    Args:
326        surface_value: Sliding surface value s
327        K: Reaching law gain (> 0)
328        alpha: Power exponent (0 < α < 1 for finite-time)
329        epsilon: Boundary layer for sign approximation
330
331    Returns:
332        Power rate reaching law output
333    """
334    if K <= 0:
335        raise ValueError("Reaching law gain K must be positive")
336    if not (0 < alpha <= 1):
337        raise ValueError("Power exponent α must be in (0, 1] for stability")
338
339    s_abs_power = np.power(abs(surface_value), alpha)
340    sign_approximation = tanh_switching(surface_value, epsilon)
341
342    return -K * s_abs_power * sign_approximation

Classes¶

SwitchingMethod¶

Inherits from: Enum

Available switching function methods.

Source Code¶

1class SwitchingMethod(Enum):
2    """Available switching function methods."""
3    TANH = "tanh"
4    LINEAR = "linear"
5    SIGN = "sign"
6    SIGMOID = "sigmoid"

SwitchingFunction¶

Continuous switching functions for SMC chattering reduction.

Provides various approximations to the sign function, each with different smoothness and robustness characteristics.

Source Code¶

  1class SwitchingFunction:
  2    """
  3    Continuous switching functions for SMC chattering reduction.
  4
  5    Provides various approximations to the sign function, each with different
  6    smoothness and robustness characteristics.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, method: Union[str, SwitchingMethod] = SwitchingMethod.TANH):
 10        """
 11        Initialize switching function.
 12
 13        Args:
 14            method: Switching method ("tanh", "linear", "sign", "sigmoid")
 15        """
 16        if isinstance(method, str):
 17            try:
 18                self.method = SwitchingMethod(method.lower())
 19            except ValueError:
 20                raise ValueError(f"Unknown switching method: {method}")
 21        else:
 22            self.method = method
 23
 24        # Set the appropriate switching function
 25        self._switch_func = self._get_switching_function()
 26
 27    def _get_switching_function(self) -> Callable[[float, float], float]:
 28        """Get the appropriate switching function implementation."""
 29        if self.method == SwitchingMethod.TANH:
 30            return self._tanh_switching
 31        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.LINEAR:
 32            return self._linear_switching
 33        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.SIGN:
 34            return self._sign_switching
 35        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.SIGMOID:
 36            return self._sigmoid_switching
 37        else:
 38            raise ValueError(f"Unimplemented switching method: {self.method}")
 39
 40    def compute(self, surface_value: float, boundary_layer: float) -> float:
 41        """
 42        Compute switching function value.
 43
 44        Args:
 45            surface_value: Sliding surface value
 46            boundary_layer: Boundary layer thickness (ε > 0)
 47
 48        Returns:
 49            Switching function output in range [-1, 1]
 50        """
 51        # Mathematical safety validation
 52        if not np.isfinite(surface_value):
 53            return 0.0  # Safe fallback for invalid input
 54        if not np.isfinite(boundary_layer) or boundary_layer <= 0:
 55            boundary_layer = 1e-12  # Use minimal positive value to prevent division by zero
 56
 57        return self._switch_func(surface_value, boundary_layer)
 58
 59    def _tanh_switching(self, s: float, epsilon: float, slope: float = 3.0) -> float:
 60        """
 61        Hyperbolic tangent switching function with configurable slope.
 62
 63        Formula: tanh((slope * s)/ε)
 64
 65        Properties:
 66        - Smooth and infinitely differentiable
 67        - Bounded output: [-1, 1]
 68        - Good balance between smoothness and approximation quality
 69        - Preserves nonzero slope at origin
 70        - Configurable slope parameter for tuning smoothness (default: 3.0)
 71
 72        Args:
 73            s: Sliding surface value
 74            epsilon: Boundary layer thickness
 75            slope: Slope parameter (lower = smoother, typical range: 2-5)
 76
 77        Note:
 78            Reduced default slope from implicit 10+ to 3.0 for better chattering reduction.
 79            Original steep slopes caused near-discontinuous behavior.
 80        """
 81        # Enhanced mathematical safety
 82        if epsilon <= 0:
 83            return np.sign(s)
 84
 85        # Apply gentler slope for smoother transitions
 86        # Lower slope values (2-5) provide better chattering reduction
 87        # compared to steep slopes (10+) which behave like sign function
 88        ratio = (slope * s) / epsilon
 89
 90        # Prevent numerical overflow in tanh computation
 91        if abs(ratio) > 700:  # tanh(700) ≈ 1, tanh(-700) ≈ -1
 92            return np.sign(s)
 93
 94        return np.tanh(ratio)
 95
 96    def _linear_switching(self, s: float, epsilon: float) -> float:
 97        """
 98        Piecewise-linear saturation switching function.
 99
100        Formula: sat(s/ε) = clip(s/ε, -1, 1)
101
102        Properties:
103        - Simple and computationally efficient
104        - Bounded output: [-1, 1]
105        - Linear in boundary layer, constant outside
106        - Can cause degraded robustness near origin (zero slope outside boundary)
107        """
108        # Enhanced mathematical safety
109        if epsilon <= 0:
110            return np.sign(s)
111
112        # Safe division with overflow check
113        ratio = s / epsilon
114        if not np.isfinite(ratio):
115            return np.sign(s)
116
117        return np.clip(ratio, -1, 1)
118
119    def _sign_switching(self, s: float, epsilon: float) -> float:
120        """
121        Pure sign function (discontinuous).
122
123        Formula: sign(s)
124
125        Properties:
126        - Theoretically optimal robustness
127        - Discontinuous at origin
128        - Causes chattering in practice
129        - Use only when chattering is acceptable
130        """
131        # Epsilon is ignored for pure sign function
132        return np.sign(s)
133
134    def _sigmoid_switching(self, s: float, epsilon: float, slope: float = 4.0) -> float:
135        """
136        Sigmoid switching function with configurable slope.
137
138        Formula: 2/(1 + exp(-slope*s/ε)) - 1
139
140        Properties:
141        - Smooth and bounded
142        - Similar to tanh but different curvature
143        - Good for adaptive controllers requiring sigmoid characteristics
144        - Configurable slope (default: 4.0 for adaptive nature)
145
146        Args:
147            s: Sliding surface value
148            epsilon: Boundary layer thickness
149            slope: Slope parameter (typical: 3-5 for smooth control)
150        """
151        # Enhanced mathematical safety
152        if epsilon <= 0:
153            return np.sign(s)
154
155        # Apply configurable slope for tuning
156        ratio = -slope * s / epsilon
157
158        # Prevent numerical overflow in exponential
159        if ratio > 700:  # exp(700) overflows
160            return -1.0
161        elif ratio < -700:  # exp(-700) underflows
162            return 1.0
163
164        exp_term = np.exp(ratio)
165        if not np.isfinite(exp_term):
166            return np.sign(s)
167
168        return 2.0 / (1.0 + exp_term) - 1.0
169
170    def get_derivative(self, surface_value: float, boundary_layer: float) -> float:
171        """
172        Compute derivative of switching function.
173
174        Useful for analysis and adaptive boundary layer methods.
175        """
176        s, epsilon = surface_value, boundary_layer
177
178        if self.method == SwitchingMethod.TANH:
179            if epsilon <= 0:
180                return 0.0  # Sign function has zero derivative almost everywhere
181            tanh_val = np.tanh(s / epsilon)
182            return (1.0 - tanh_val**2) / epsilon
183
184        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.LINEAR:
185            if epsilon <= 0 or abs(s) >= epsilon:
186                return 0.0  # Zero derivative outside boundary layer
187            return 1.0 / epsilon
188
189        elif self.method == SwitchingMethod.SIGMOID:
190            if epsilon <= 0:
191                return 0.0
192            exp_term = np.exp(-2.0 * s / epsilon)
193            return (4.0 / epsilon) * exp_term / (1.0 + exp_term)**2
194
195        else:  # SIGN
196            return 0.0

Functions¶

tanh_switching(s, epsilon, slope)¶

Hyperbolic tangent switching function with optimized slope.

Args: s: Sliding surface value epsilon: Boundary layer thickness slope: Slope parameter (default: 3.0 for optimal chattering reduction)

Returns: tanh((slope * s)/ε) ∈ [-1, 1]

Note: Default slope reduced from steep (10+) to gentle (3.0) for better chattering reduction. Use slope=2-5 for smooth control, slope>5 approaches discontinuous behavior.

Source Code¶

 1def tanh_switching(s: float, epsilon: float, slope: float = 3.0) -> float:
 2    """
 3    Hyperbolic tangent switching function with optimized slope.
 4
 5    Args:
 6        s: Sliding surface value
 7        epsilon: Boundary layer thickness
 8        slope: Slope parameter (default: 3.0 for optimal chattering reduction)
 9
10    Returns:
11        tanh((slope * s)/ε) ∈ [-1, 1]
12
13    Note:
14        Default slope reduced from steep (10+) to gentle (3.0) for better
15        chattering reduction. Use slope=2-5 for smooth control, slope>5
16        approaches discontinuous behavior.
17    """
18    if epsilon <= 0:
19        return np.sign(s)
20    ratio = (slope * s) / epsilon
21    if abs(ratio) > 700:
22        return np.sign(s)
23    return np.tanh(ratio)

linear_switching(s, epsilon)¶

Linear saturation switching function.

Args: s: Sliding surface value epsilon: Boundary layer thickness

Returns: sat(s/ε) = clip(s/ε, -1, 1)

Source Code¶

 1def linear_switching(s: float, epsilon: float) -> float:
 2    """
 3    Linear saturation switching function.
 4
 5    Args:
 6        s: Sliding surface value
 7        epsilon: Boundary layer thickness
 8
 9    Returns:
10        sat(s/ε) = clip(s/ε, -1, 1)
11    """
12    if epsilon <= 0:
13        return np.sign(s)
14    return np.clip(s / epsilon, -1, 1)

sign_switching(s, epsilon)¶

Pure sign function (DEPRECATED - causes severe chattering).

WARNING: Discontinuous switching causes chattering in real systems. Prefer tanh_switching() or linear_switching() with appropriate boundary layer.

Args: s: Sliding surface value epsilon: Ignored (kept for interface consistency)

Returns: sign(s) ∈ {-1, 0, 1}

Deprecated: Use tanh_switching(s, epsilon, slope=3.0) instead for chattering reduction.

Source Code¶

 1def sign_switching(s: float, epsilon: float = 0.0) -> float:
 2    """
 3    Pure sign function (DEPRECATED - causes severe chattering).
 4
 5    WARNING: Discontinuous switching causes chattering in real systems.
 6    Prefer tanh_switching() or linear_switching() with appropriate boundary layer.
 7
 8    Args:
 9        s: Sliding surface value
10        epsilon: Ignored (kept for interface consistency)
11
12    Returns:
13        sign(s) ∈ {-1, 0, 1}
14
15    Deprecated:
16        Use tanh_switching(s, epsilon, slope=3.0) instead for chattering reduction.
17    """
18    import warnings
19    warnings.warn(
20        "sign_switching() is deprecated and causes severe chattering. "
21        "Use tanh_switching(s, epsilon, slope=3.0) for smooth control.",
22        DeprecationWarning,
23        stacklevel=2
24    )
25    return np.sign(s)

adaptive_boundary_layer(surface_value, surface_derivative, base_epsilon, adaptation_gain)¶

Adaptive boundary layer thickness based on surface derivative.

Larger ε when |ṡ| is large (fast surface motion) to increase smoothness. Smaller ε when |ṡ| is small (near surface) to maintain precision.

Args: surface_value: Current sliding surface value surface_derivative: Surface time derivative ṡ base_epsilon: Base boundary layer thickness adaptation_gain: Adaptation coefficient

Returns: Adaptive boundary layer thickness

Source Code¶

 1def adaptive_boundary_layer(surface_value: float, surface_derivative: float,
 2                           base_epsilon: float, adaptation_gain: float = 0.1) -> float:
 3    """
 4    Adaptive boundary layer thickness based on surface derivative.
 5
 6    Larger ε when |ṡ| is large (fast surface motion) to increase smoothness.
 7    Smaller ε when |ṡ| is small (near surface) to maintain precision.
 8
 9    Args:
10        surface_value: Current sliding surface value
11        surface_derivative: Surface time derivative ṡ
12        base_epsilon: Base boundary layer thickness
13        adaptation_gain: Adaptation coefficient
14
15    Returns:
16        Adaptive boundary layer thickness
17    """
18    adaptive_component = adaptation_gain * abs(surface_derivative)
19    return base_epsilon + adaptive_component

power_rate_reaching_law(surface_value, K, alpha, epsilon)¶

Power rate reaching law for finite-time convergence.

Formula: -K * |s|^α * sign(s) ≈ -K * |s|^α * tanh(s/ε)

Args: surface_value: Sliding surface value s K: Reaching law gain (> 0) alpha: Power exponent (0 < α < 1 for finite-time) epsilon: Boundary layer for sign approximation

Returns: Power rate reaching law output

Source Code¶

 1def power_rate_reaching_law(surface_value: float, K: float, alpha: float,
 2                           epsilon: float = 0.01) -> float:
 3    """
 4    Power rate reaching law for finite-time convergence.
 5
 6    Formula: -K * |s|^α * sign(s) ≈ -K * |s|^α * tanh(s/ε)
 7
 8    Args:
 9        surface_value: Sliding surface value s
10        K: Reaching law gain (> 0)
11        alpha: Power exponent (0 < α < 1 for finite-time)
12        epsilon: Boundary layer for sign approximation
13
14    Returns:
15        Power rate reaching law output
16    """
17    if K <= 0:
18        raise ValueError("Reaching law gain K must be positive")
19    if not (0 < alpha <= 1):
20        raise ValueError("Power exponent α must be in (0, 1] for stability")
21
22    s_abs_power = np.power(abs(surface_value), alpha)
23    sign_approximation = tanh_switching(surface_value, epsilon)
24
25    return -K * s_abs_power * sign_approximation
